aphorisms.contents: STOP
sit quietly
ask for openness
your job is to feel
learn from breathing
letting out is letting go, of thinking
all things pass even to die

time slows

to the space of a breath
aphorisms.endnote: “Awareness, Acceptance, and Action” are known as the Three A‘s in twelve-step programs

aphorisms.contents:
the best I can do

is to take care of myself

at my worst

if all I can do

is to sit

lost in confusion

then so be it

perform healing tasks

however small

experience

pleasure, relaxation, comfort
fullfill a longing

prioritize by doing

and watching

what is done

expand your center

until it encompasses all

if there is pain or fear

“Bring It On”

“I love pain”

“Pain sets me free”
aphorisms.endnote: “Bring It On,” “I love pain,” and “Pain sets me free” come from The Tools by Phil Stutz and Barry Michels

aphorisms.contents:
Can you live in the world

where nothing is wrong?

when everything feels wrong

it is a judgment-mechanism

it is not part of you

feel the pain

that is the way to compassion

when it hurts to decide between the virulent possibilities

do nothing

hold yourself in sympathy

ask for help
follow your nose around
slow down

I'm in no hurry

I have no future projection
take time to heal

honor suffering

when experience is suffering

it is not forever

look under shame

and anxiety

there is pain there

don't decide the little choices

let them happen on their own

let go of control

let the decisions come to you

anxiety doesn't serve you

it shuts off your connections

so give way and feel under
turn off the clocks
my higher power is the endless now

it's okay to feel bad

or weak or wrong

or small

don't try to fix it

letting go leads

to well-being in the moment

I'm not doing anything wrong

everything (I could do)

is already correct

hiding from the world

is sometimes healing

every moment is exactly perfect

including those when you feel

only fear, shame, hyper-vigilance

use that knowledge to feel under the fear

and let go

still perfect

regardless of result

I cannot force myself to exist

in the endless now

... however ...

it is easy

take breath

exhale

let go all time

ask for receptivity

cultivate: “Openness Gentleness Kindness”
aphorisms.endnote: The refrain “Openness Gentleness Kindness” comes from Pema Chodron, The Wisdom of No Escape

aphorisms.contents:
shame is the language of the oppressor

Resist!

even if—especially if—it's in your own head

trust in the What

and the Why will answer itself
the highest good is taking care of myself

STOP forcing yourself to do what you should

DO only that which you want to

that which gives you pleasure

suspend evaluation

that cacophony of judgment

liberation is the feeling

when all constraints fall away

and my powers expand

and proudly burst forth
take up space
